definition: to ascertain/to act on/to criticize/to pass on/classifier for batches, lots, military flights/tier (for the ranking of universities and colleges)

sentences.english: Do some critical thinking and write your thesis statement down in one sentence.
sentences.chinese: 做一些批判性的思考，并用一句话陈述出你的论点。

sentences.english: Instead of being judgmental, we too should be accepting of sexuality in the later years.
sentences.chinese: 我们也应该接受年纪大的人的性事，而不应该去批判。

sentences.english: What starts as criticism of the foreign can quickly swing to domestic targets.
sentences.chinese: 对于外国的批判可以很快摇身一变指向内部的目标。

sentences.english: Substance of critical thinking is evaluation and comprehension.
sentences.chinese: 批判性思维的实质是评价性和综合性。

sentences.english: Thinking critically can enable one to analyze problems insightfully.
sentences.chinese: 批判性思考能够使你在分析问题时富有洞察力。

sentences.english: In criticizing and transcending over traditional metaphysics, Heidegger and Whitehead adopted different approaches but yielded the same excellent results.
sentences.chinese: 二者对传统形而上学的批判与超越具有异工同曲之妙。

sentences.english: Lit-sen Chang, Critique of Indigenous Theology.
First, he has criticized the privacy of personal experience.
sentences.chinese: 首先，是对个人经验私人性的批判。

sentences.english: The second cycle began with criticism and reconsideration of the Confucian Ethics.
sentences.chinese: 第二个周期从批判和反思两汉“名教”开始。

sentences.english: Yale University Department of English and literature have been critical of the new school movement.
sentences.chinese: 耶鲁大学的英文和文学系曾属于新批判运动学派。

sentences.english: This novel criticizes the peasants' uprising and sing the praises of the reactionary rulers.
sentences.chinese: 这本小说批判农民起义，但对反动统治者歌功颂德。

sentences.english: Of course, when engaging in criticism we should present facts, reason things out and guard against being one-sided.
sentences.chinese: 当然，批判的时候要摆事实，讲道理，防止片面性。

sentences.english: The second part discusses a scholar criticized Gadamer's theory.
sentences.chinese: 第二章的主要内容是赫施对伽达默尔的批判。

sentences.english: Mindfulness helps us be more open-minded and less critical.
sentences.chinese: 专注力使我们更加虚心，少些批判。

sentences.english: The second part is mainly about Irigaray's criticism of male discourse.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分，伊利格瑞对西方父权制话语的批判。

sentences.english: Again, Lu also showed his leftist mind in his criticism of the Guomingtang authorities.
sentences.chinese: 其次，鲁迅的左倾也体现在对国民党当局的批判中。

definition: to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
